meta_description: Seattle's Free Art Museum | Founded in 1952, the Frye Art Museum brings together art and new ideas within a stunning Olson Sundberg Kundig-designed building in historic First Hill.
hours_text:
# Visit the Frye

## Seattle's Free Art Museum

Founded in 1952, the Frye Art Museum brings together art and new ideas within a stunning Olson Sundberg Kundig-designed building in historic First Hill.

## Free Admission

The Frye is open 11 am–5 pm Wednesday through Sunday, and 11 am–8 pm Thursday. Admission to the Frye galleries is always free!

[ ](/exhibitions)

## [What's On ](/exhibitions)

Enjoy a full and diverse viewing experience, from [thoughtful collection presentations to temporary exhibitions](https://fryemuseum.org/exhibitions) and fresh takes on complex issues by local and global artists.

The Frye is also host to artist talks, lectures, performances, receptions, and more—[visit the calendar](/calendar) or [sign up for Frye emails](/mailing-list) to stay up to date.

## While You're Here

Visit [MariPili at Café Frieda](/cafe) for coffee, tea, drinks, and Spanish-inspired small plates and lunch options (plus Thursday happy hour).

Shop exhibition related materials and a curated collection of one-of-a-kind goods by local makers at the [Museum Store](https://store.fryemuseum.org).

## Getting to the Frye

The Frye is located in Seattle's First Hill neighborhood, minutes from local bus connections and close to Capitol Hill and Downtown Seattle. [Get directions](https://maps.app.goo.gl/Jg24U1o8wEFVHKG76). 

###  Location & Hours Plus Icon Minus Icon

### Location

[704 Terry Avenue](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Frye+Art+Museum/@47.6069433,-122.3262586,17z/data...
admission_text:
# Membership

Photo: Jueqian Fang 

## Why the Frye?

Frye members get insider access to the latest exhibitions and the chance to connect with the Seattle arts community in unique ways. Join today to stay in the know, unlock special discounts, and get your invitations to members-only events all year long.

Showcasing the museum’s collection, presenting cutting-edge contemporary exhibitions, supporting local artists, and offering inclusive programs for the community—all are made possible by Frye members. Membership not only enriches your experience at the Frye, but makes an impact in the community far beyond the museum walls.

**Monthly Memberships!** To make membership more accessible, we offer monthly automatic payment options for the Aficionado, Advocate, Ambassador, and Art Circle levels.

[Join or Renew Now](/membership) [Membership FAQs](/membership-faqs) [Membership Partner Discounts](/frye-membership-partners)

Photo: Jueqian Fang 

**Questions?**

Please call 206 432 8227 or email [membership@fryemuseum.org](mailto:membership@fryemuseum.org) for assistance with membership.

For donation related questions, please refer to our [Donate page](/donate).

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility at the Frye

The Frye Art Museum is committed to fostering a welcoming and inclusive space for everyone. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in order to strengthen our organization and our community. The Frye provides a variety of services for visitors stopping by the museum or participating in in-person or virtual programs to make the most of your experience. We will continue to work on our goal of expanding services in order to offer a rich visitor experience for all. If you have any additional questions about accessibility at the Frye, please contact [visitorservices@fryemuseum.org](mailto:visitorservices@fryemuseum.org).

### ONGOING ACCESSIBILITY UPGRADES

In fall 2022, the Frye commissioned a comprehensive facility accessibility audit from [Studio Pacifica](https://studiopacificaseattle.com/ "Studio Pacifica Seattle"). We are now working to implement and plan for the necessary facility updates as outlined in their report, which includes design work in the Store, Café, and public restrooms. We thank you for your patience as we work to improve our facilities to be more inclusive. 

### ACCESSIBILITY ACCOMMODATIONS FOR PROGRAMS AND EVENTS AT THE MUSEUM

  * If you are unable to register for programs or events online, you may call us at 206 432 8219 from Tuesday through Saturday, 10 am to 4 pm Pacific Time.
  * Assistive listening devices are available upon request for all programs and events in the Frye’s Auditorium. A new set of e...
